services
Class XmlService

java.lang.Object
  services.XmlService

public class XmlService
extends java.lang.Object

Handles the communication between server, clients and spiders.

Author:
ivaylo

Method Detail

writeObject

public void writeObject(java.lang.Object obj)
Sends obj to the other party in the communication. The other application should know what kind of Object is expected.

Parameters:
obj - The Object that should be written

readObject

public java.lang.Object readObject()
Reads an Object from the other party in the communication. Blocks until data is present.

Returns:
Object that the other party has sent.

isClosed

public boolean isClosed()
Checks if the connunication can still be used.

Returns:
whether the communication was closed.

close

public void close()
Initialized a close of the connection between the two applications.

serverClose

public void serverClose()
Only closes the connection the server side of the connection when the other side is already closed.

createXMLHandler

public static XmlService createXMLHandler(java.lang.String hostName,
                                          int port)
Creates new XML Object that will serve for communication with the other application.

Parameters:
hostName - The host that we want to connect to.
port - The port that we want to connect to.
Returns:
New XMLHandler object or null if the communication failed.

createXMLHandler

public static XmlService createXMLHandler(java.net.Socket s)
Creates new XML Object that will serve for communication with the other application.

Parameters:
s - The socket that should be used for communication.
Returns:
New XMLHandler object or null if the communication failed.
